column4: when I mount a folder with sshfs and check folder properties it states 0 bytes free, I know this is wrong how can I get around this?
this is normal behaviour ;-) it's probably in the sshfs faq somewhere
but then when I try to move a file into the folder I get an error saying that the file can not be copies because there is no room
I don't remember getting this error before, and now I cannot upload a file to that folder

very strange, normally sshfs would state "1000Gb" (1Tb free) incorrectly, as "the SFTP protocol doesn't have a statfs operation this is currently not possible to display proper usage on remote partition"
are you sure there is space left on the remote partition ?
yes I am sure, the drive has about 30GB of free space left
hmm, this link (http://fritzthomas.com/open-source/linux/343-no-space-left-on-device-error-with-sshfs-how-to-fix-it/) suggests this could be a bug that was introduced recently
interesting I'll give that a try and see if it works
you could download the deb for your architecture and then install it with sudo dpkg -i filename_xxx.deb
doing it now, I wonder if I need the same version of sshfs on both machines?
probably not, as the remote end only needs ssh-server
you'd only need fuse and sshfs on the connecting end
Wow that worked! thanks, and now its even reporting the correct size of the drive
well that's better ;-) then the "1000 gb"- free space-bug was probably arlready fixed in sshfs a while ago
thanks again for hte help that worked like a charm
